reviews.review_text: I come here every time I visit Vancouver to see my family and it never disappoints. Great food, good sized portions, friendly service, and the price is very very good, especially for Vancouver! I highly recommend it to everyone. Its also very conveniently located next to Waterfront station, right downtown.

This is 11/10!!!   Had a hard time ordering since they have lots of good things on their menu. I ordered their Spicy Chirashi Sushi Don      - definitely a favorite of mine!! Something I wont ever forget   , friend ordered a Unagi Ka-Ke and we shared the Aburi set   that comes with Unagi that just melts on your mouth! Food and seafood are very fresh. Again. 11/10

Ummm 10/10! Give me more stars to GIVE GOOGLE. I started with 16 sushi s which equals two special rolls. I had no idea what to expect or if this would be enough. The rolls were GREAT sized; in fact perfect. My first bite I actually had an explosion of each independent flavour coming together. It was like in FOOD WARS when the song comes on and someone has a FOODGASM. Both rolls were BOMB BOMB BOMB; so I proceeded to order a SAKE in-line , alongside a Chicken Curry Katsu. Providing a detailed video of each dish; photos of the menu for you to enjoy and the SAKE/Atmosphere. Giving the atmosphere a 5/5 because of the music.  Don t miss out on this friends =). If you enjoy your experience and agree drop this review a like for the business    keeping our reviews just, fair and authentic.
Delicious every time and my take out is always ready when I get there. A busy place (always a good sign) and I find the prices very reasonable
Their rice bowls here are outstanding, and haven t been disappointed once. Likely my favourite lunch spot in all of Vancouver. Highly recommend!

Great Meal for a Great price. Will go back for sure. I had the Chirashi Don which was very good! They have so many options for food. You can choose between water or green tea (unlimited refill) which was nice, the tea is delicious. Food

I went there twice on the week I was in town for a conference. Ordering online made it super easy for me to walk in and grab it immediately. The ladies who were at the front desk were so polite and nice. Each item I ordered was delicious and there are so many different options that youre sure to find something.

Had a great 1st meal in Vancouver after flying over from the UK. We had teriyaki beef don and chicken katsu, and some tea and really enjoyed it. The service was very cheerful and quick. The portions are large by British standards. This was a great experience -thank you !

Excellent donburi and curry place. I loved the katsu-mori curry and my parents really enjoyed their beef teriyaki and chicken karage dons. Would definitely come back here again. Recommend eating there in person over takeout

The food is great! We come here almost every time we are downtown because the location is convenient and the food is so good. Plus the prices are really reasonable for downtown Vancouver, and good portion sizes (with what Ive had here so far anyway)
Delicious Pork Don. Very reasonable price. Its more like a fast japanese food restaurant.  Its nice that they offer free cup of tea to customers.
One of the quickest and most delicious meals I ve had in a lifetime. Thank you, Kita no Donburi! Sayonara.
Quick service and pretty good variety of options. Havent tried all the dishes but the ones I did did not disappoint!
Amazing fresh sushi. Loved the hanabi roll. All of the servers were very friendly. So glad we found this place.
this and busy spot, that means its good! presentation is a work of art. so delicious

Much as its a small place, there wasnt a long wait, were seated right away. They follow covid protocols so be ready with your vaccine card and a peace of ID. There is a peaceful ambiance in here and the servers are lovely. Food is served right on time and what surprised me is the huge portions they serve compared to other places The prices are reasonable in regards to the food. I will be eating every time I am DT. We did enjoy our time here and everything went on well.

I enjoyed this place so much! We had the Takoyaki, Katsudon and Katsu Curry. All of them delicious, but my favorite was definitely de Katsu Curry. They had a small beverage selection, which in my opinion had all the democratic basics. We had a Sapporo and an Asahi. Fairly priced, not so busy that you have to wait in line for hours, delicious food, friendly service (: I definitely recommend.
By far the best sushi I ve had to date. Service was great and food was incredibly fast

Small and friendly japanese restaurant. I went there during weekend, it wasnt busy.  The waitress was cordial and helpful. The miso soup was so tasty and not salty, perfect. I tried a pork katsu with curry rice. It was really good. The katsu was fresh and crunchy. The spicy salmon roll was super yummy as well. I do recommend checking out this restaurant.

It was 6 years ago when I first had dining experience here, and they still got it. I always order Unagi don here, as it is served in stone bowl which make the don taste better for me. Miso soup is complementary if you order a meal. Staffs were always super friendly and as they spoke some Japanese, it feels like I was having authentic Japanese experience. They also do some seasonal off-menu, and I loved their jaru soba too. If you are near Waterfront and wondering what to eat, here is your place!
Super delicious katsudon!! I ordered with tomago (egg) on top for more flavor complexity. Not too busy but filled up with people while I was there.
Incredibly good! We had the Kakuni Don and Sha Ke Don which were both fantastic. Very nice staff :)

Best traditional Japanese restaurant in Vancouver!   We will definitely come back here again.   If you like Natto, Sakano Nobori is a must-try.   Shrimp tempura was so good, too!   Down on earth, very reasonable price.

The prices are SO good for the huge portion you get for the donburis! We ordered the chirashi (top) and sha-ke don (bottom) (picture attached). Our orders arrived ~10min after ordering, and the staff were courteous, friendly, and checked up on us at the right times. Will come back to enjoy their other donburis in the future.

Probably the most authentic katsu curry Ive had outside of Japan. Taste and preparation are very similar. Was pretty busy at dinner time but we got the last table. They have a pretty extensive menu but we both got the chicken katsu curry, which was very good. Most people around us had a curry dish as well. Price was under $30 total before tip. Wheelchair accessibility: No step coming in from sidewalk.

Ive been here two times in the last week and both times did not disappoint! The sushi platter, katsu don, takopachi and unagi don were all on point. The sushi tastes very fresh and the tuna nigiri melts in your mouth with the smoothest texture. The unagi don would be better with a little more sauce in the rice but all in all, a nice place to go to in Vancouver when youre craving Japanese rice bowls and sushi.
I had the #2 Kakuni Don on Donburis menu section It has 966kcal steamed sweet bean sprout. pork loin. Don t forget to ask to add a egg and extra jalapenos
Got one of the unagi rice bowls and it was delicious. They have many options on the menu that I cant wait to try next time. Great food, value, and service!

Always delicious donburi at a great price. I always come here for a quick filling meal. Highly recommend the gyudon. The curry donburi are also huge. One negative thing is the ventilation in this restaurant is terrible. If you dine in, youll come out smelling incredibly greasy.

Clean and crowded Japanese restaurant in downtown Vancouver. They serve fresh and delicious food. Their menu was very creative and i really like the food. Also to add average price for one dish is about $10 so totally worth it.
Came here for lunch with some friends. Ordered the Katsu Curry and it was good. Nice spot for donburi.
I ordered the curry katsu don. It was really good. Awesome music selection (Lots of Japanese anime music). Great restaurant overall. I would definitely come again!
Delicious sukiyaki don! I would highly recommend this restaurant for a well served and reasonably priced don!
Great donburi in Downtown. The menu is relatively ample but not extravagant, dishes are mostly traditional with some local variant. My donburi was amazing. Highly recommended!!
Simple dishes with nice flavor.  We tried the pork and chicken donburi. A lot of vegetables and decent amount of meat.
You cant go wrong with the food, I went for lunch here back to back. Pretty small and its generally ideal to get in before 12pm not to get too caught up in the rush.

This place is great for what it is. A no-frill Japanese restaurant serving up delicious Japanese food. The food is always on point and service is decent. The price is reasonable. Can get busy during lunch.

Best donburi restaurant in Vancouver. Tastes just as authentic as restaurants in Japan. Employees are from Japan, service is excellent.   Lunch set is the most worthwhile and the quality wont let you down. One of my most favourite restaurants in Vancouver.
Delicious donburi, went for the straight forward pork and the meat was so well cooked, non greasy, yummy onions. Miso was also great.

Amazing and kid friendly meal   we ordered Wahoo Shokuya and shared it with my picky 3yr old kiddo  he absolutely love  the soba and tried the fried tempura  would recommend this to any parents with picky eaters Kid-friendliness: They have a high chair to accommodate and you have limited space to park stroller still has rooms.
The best Don place in Vancouver! Extremely good price, high value, good service, amazing plating and tasty food!

This place is excellent! They follow the COVID-19 protocol - hand sanitizer and paper/pen for diners  contact information. Server is very sweet and knows her menu. Excellent service.  Excellent food!!!
Amazing food. Full of flavour. Everything melted in our mouth. Very fresh. Beautiful presentation. Excellent customer service. Highly recommended. Food
Quick service. The portion is just perfect for lunch break. Good price. I will go there again for sure. The chirashi don in my picture was $15. It came with miso soup.
I had the Katsu curry for take out and really liked the taste.  Three pieces of fried chicken were enough for me.
Reasonable price and good taste
The food is out of this world. Best sushi I ever tasted. Highly recommended. It was very busy, noisy and cramped, but the food was definitely worth it.
If you love Japanese food, here is a gem! We didnt try the sushi, but the bowls are tasty to the last kernel of rice.
Best place to eat Japanese for food  and I love the Takoyaki they serve. It was full fill and satisfying.
Staff were so friendly, food came unbelievably fast (5 minutes or less?!), and food was totally delicious. Will come many more times!
We order oyako don, chicken kazu curry, kazu don. All of them were super good and the price is really amazing. Servants are really friendly. Highly recommend.
Absolutely one of the best Japanese food and service in town. Highly recommended spicy chirashi and all sort of rolls

Very kind waitress, specially the one who is more experienced. Very polite, with a smile on her face all the time. As for the food itself, what a wonderful surprise, the Katsu Donburi I shall never forget. To me, this certainly should be interpreted as comfort food. The mix between the rice, the egg poured on top of that burning hot ingredients and the meat is just tasteful. As a courtesy, they will serve you miso soup, which has very good, just missed the pieces of Tofu, as we usually have it served at the Japanese Restaurants in Sao Paulo, Brazil. Highly recommend when in Vancouver.
Ive seen this place forever and we finally went in! Surprisingly nice! I was expecting much less... Quite cozy and good food! We will be back!

Whoa, what a busy spot!  Definitely legit for donburi and everyone knows it.  I recommend coming outside of peak lunch hours if you want a table quickly but the vibe and the food is totally worth it.  I noticed many folks picking up the take-out they ordered online and this is most definitely what I will be doing next since I work 1 block away.  Also did I mention?  Portion size is huge and price is very affordable!!
Been here many times for their Spicy Tuna Don, its so good!

Food was amazing, staff is friendly and helpful, decor is simple and cute. I would recommend and happily go again. Japanese food is much more than only sushi. Wheelchair accessibility: Space is limited so it might be challenging to accommodate a wheelchair unfortunately. However one can always order delivery.
My second visit here. Their foods are always fresh and cooked properly! This is one of my favorite Japense restaurant in downtown Vancouver.
Enjoyed the lunch sets here. Food was fresh and tasted great.
My favorite donburi place in downtown area. The price is very reasonable and the food is tasty. The restaurant is a bit tight and remind you of diners in Japan in general.
Really good Japanese food that don t just serve the typical sushi but a lot more. Love this place.
Delicious sushi. No fuss. Fast service.

My family and I were passing by and decided to give it a try. We were pleasantly surprised about how good it was. If you are around the area, give it a try. Good was fresh and delicious. The miso soup was excellent.
My goto Japanese food place downtown. Great selection with good prices. However, expect to smell like the restaurant for the rest of the day
Our family hadnt been out in a while, and this was a treat. This little restaurant serves delicious Japanese food, the service was good and the prices were not expensive. Yummy food.
Usually the place I go to for Tonkatsu since its the closest to my work. They always do delivery via lazy meal. They are usually pretty efficient and you wont have to wait long
Great restaurant for a quick bite, either for lunch or dinner. The prices are reasonable and the service is good. They have a nice selection on their menu as well.
Food is authentic! Very busy during lunch!
The food is great here! I got the oyakodon and it was the best oyakodon Ive had. Very flavourful and delicious seasoning.
Nice little place to visit. Not the biggest selection of rolls but food was good. Smaller portion then most other places Ive had but still yummy!
Delicious lunch set take out! Theres also miso soup and soba noodles that are not in the photos.
Tried the Chirashi. Fresh sashimi, rice is on the harder side but well within expectations.
Super delicious, great place for authentic Japanese food.
Fantastic place, lots of affordable, filling and tasty items. Everything I tried so far is good: the chirashi, the Donburi and the battera (some sort of bigger thicker sushi !)

Very kind service and wonderful food! Very busy place with many interesting seating options and visually pleasing decor! The price is great for what you get! Great if you re looking for a hot meal any time in the day!
We loved Kita No Donburi! Really delicious authentic Japanese food. My husband and I had lived in Japan once upon a time and this place made us very nostalgic.
Feels like eating in Japan. Fresh authentic food and good service. Self serve water and tea when you eat in. Expect long lines at lunch time.
Friendly staff,  delicious food, service was quick! Ill definitely come back!
Decently priced donburi, fast service, big portion.
Amazing service and food. One of the best restaurants in Vancouver!
Super friendly server, it was nice to hear a lot of the customers speaking Japanese.
Terrific quality an presentation.  Will definitely return

Amazing place to have lunch, the usual lunch here includes tea and miso soup so it is complete. There are lots of options, service here is superb they deserve 6 stars. Everything that I had here have impressed me specifically the gyo don (beef and egg rice bowl).
Their hot sake and oyako don are the most perfect thing on cold drizzling days. My husband and I run a Japanese food truck so Im pretty picky. They absolutely do not disappoint.
Amazing donburi! Fresh fish, full bowl, a tasty treat!
The food was good and the staff were very friendly.

This cozy izakaya almost made me break my vacation rule of no repeat restaurants--theres a wide selection of menu items, and everything was delicious. From the moment you enter theres a welcoming atmosphere, and youll have plenty of jasmine tea to drink while you try to figure out an achievable number of dishes to pick off the menu. You cant go wrong with any of the don options--katsudon and chirashizushi featured this time, but each item comes with plenty of toppings and cooked-just-right rice. A hanabi sushi roll and corokke (sweet potato croquette) rounded out the meal. Everything tasted great, and the seafood selection was plenty fresh. Be prepared to make some hard decisions on which combination calls to you--our server was happy to make a few recommendations and quick to bring them out once confirmed. Prices were really good, too; less than I would have expected for the quality of food and experience.
Fresh sashimi with miso soup. Food was delicious. Recommand to go early before lunch or dinner time.
Very authentic, great meal and staff.

I loved the food, excellent service and very nice personal. The feature I appreciate the most is that you can order online. Once its confirmed your order, you just have to pick up and enjoy. The menu is quite good for a reasonable price. The katsu lunch set really satisfy your hunger. If you can try the curry.
Ordered pickup through their website. Order was ready very quickly and food was tasty. Generous portions for the price, great value.

Their salmon don is possibly the best in town. I love it! The menu has calories near each item, which i appreciate. I try to do take out as if you eat in your clothes will absorb the cooking smells. The prices are also very reasonable. Overall a great spot!
Amazing food , very nice staff. Highly recommended
Great selection, excellent food. Proper unsweetened tea. You wouldn t know you re not in Japan.
Nice spot for the donburi and sushi, whether dining alone or with coworkers. Prices are reasonable and food comes relatively quickly. Place is authentically Japanese owned and staffed.
Always love eating here. Staff is always so friendly and accommodating. Food is delicious everytime too. Chicken karaage don is my go to! Ebi Hurai and the croquettes are a must try as well.

One of my and my wifes favorite place for food in Vancouver. The portions are always good, service fast for sit-down, and it has a great menu. If you want some Japanese ouch, I highly suggest you go here!

Super friendly servers and kitchen staff! Food is amazing, and chefs are very kind, open to feedback and improvement. Brown rice option is available. Lunch sets are must try. You ll see a longer line-up in lunchtime, however waiting time is not bad since they have a high customer turnover ratio.
Fantastic sushi, best we ve ever eaten!
This place has great prices and delicious food that will leave you satisfied and full.
